definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: She's stretched out in the sun.
sentences.chinese: 她伸開四肢躺在太陽下。

sentences.english: Guillermo put his arm around her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 吉爾勒莫伸開胳膊摟住她的肩膀。

sentences.english: A praying mantis spreads its wings.
sentences.chinese: 一隻螳螂正在伸開它的翅膀。

sentences.english: He doubled up his legs and kicked out.
Arms outspread, the completed robe with hood will form an "Ankh."
sentences.chinese: 伸開雙臂，完成袍罩將形成一個“十字章。”

sentences.english: He stretched out and stared at the ceiling, as was his habit after work.
sentences.chinese: 他四肢伸開，眼睛盯着天花板，這是他下班後習慣。

sentences.english: He was sprawling in an armchair in front of the TV.
sentences.chinese: 他伸開手腳坐在電視機旁的單座沙發上。

sentences.english: Down I went, sprawled on all fours.
his left hand was still cramped, but he was unknotting it slowly.
sentences.chinese: 他的左手傲然在抽筋，但他正在逐步地把它伸開。

sentences.english: We spread ourselves on wheat straw on the farm when we were tired.
sentences.chinese: 我們累了就伸開四肢仰臥在農場的麥秸上。

sentences.english: She smacked him with her open hand.
sentences.chinese: 她伸開手打了他一巴掌。

sentences.english: Let not thy hand be stretched out to receive, and shut when thou shouldst give.
sentences.chinese: 你的手不要只爲領取才伸開，而在施恩時縮回。
